summary: The Dewey Decimal Classification (DDC) is a system used in libraries to organize books by subject. Created by Melvil Dewey in 1876, it uses decimal numbers to categorize books, allowing new additions to be easily placed on shelves. This system, maintained by OCLC, is flexible and detailed, helping users find and return books quickly. It's used in over 200,000 libraries worldwide.
title: Dewey Decimal Classification
